description: From French déisme, from Latin deus (“god, deity”)  +‎ -ism.

entries.meaning: A philosophical belief in the existence of a god (or goddess) knowable through human reason; especially, a belief in a creator god unaccompanied by any belief in supernatural phenomena or specific religious doctrines.
examples: If my supposition be true, then the consequence which I have assumed in my Poem may be also true; namely, that Deism, or the principles of natural worship, are only the faint remnants or dying flames of reveal'd religion in the posterity of Noah.

entries.meaning: Belief in a god who ceased to intervene with existence after acting as the cause of the cosmos.
